title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 01:09  
jvdrean left #xwiki at 01:09  
sdumitriu left at 01:11 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds

mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:55

sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:32  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 08:41  
evalica joined #xwiki at 08:53

florinciu joined #xwiki at 09:34  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:35  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 09:57  
lucaa left at 10:11 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
florinciu left at 10:13 (Quit: Leaving.  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:13  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 10:15  
florinciu left at 10:25 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:27  
vmassol - (10:27): guys, anyone knows if myxwiki.org has been updated with the macro cache fix?  
sburjan - (10:29): vmassol : I'm starting slowly to get a grip of the proto framework we discussed on the last conference  
sburjan - (10:29): and .. i have a quick question  
sburjan - (10:29): I see that we have no pageObjects for WatchlistPage, PreferencesPage, ProfilePage  
sburjan - (10:30): from the Top right menu  
vmassol - (10:30): because the tests for these have not been moved to the new fwk yet I guess  
sburjan - (10:30): should I try to extend ?  
vmassol - (10:30): sure  
sburjan - (10:30): okay  
vmassol - (10:33): jvdrean: there's no 2.4RC1 in http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/project/ViewProject.jspa?pid=10222, thomas has forgotten?  
vmassol - (10:33): oops  
vmassol - (10:33): my bad  
vmassol - (10:34): I should go back to sleep  
jvdrean - (10:34): :)  
penyaskito - (10:42): hi, when I click on a tag, it doesn't show the pages with that tag but the list of all tags, anyone has experienced this behavior?  
penyaskito - (10:43): I'm using XWiki Enterprise 2.3.1.29118  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:58

arkub joined #xwiki at 12:44  
penyaskito - (12:44): anyone listening?  
DSpair joined #xwiki at 13:30  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:39  
jvdrean - (14:04): all lights are green (except a flickering test in the wysiwyg), starting the 2.3.2 release in a few minutes  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 14:21  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 14:29  
sdumitriu - (14:29): jvdrean: Hold on the release a bit  
jvdrean - (14:30): sdumitriu: ok, I forgot to commit the translations in core anyway  
jvdrean - (14:31): what do you want to commit ?  
sdumitriu - (14:31): Nothing, I just wanted to check something  
sdumitriu - (14:31): It's OK, you can continue  
sdumitriu - (14:32): I didn't see when you changed the dependency for xskinx-1.13 to be 2.3-SNAPSHOT instead of 2.4-SNAPSHOT  
evalica left #xwiki at 14:36  
sdumitriu left at 15:05 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 15:05  
sdumitriu left at 15:11 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
lucaa - (15:36): guys, there seems to be an issue with annotations on the last 2.4 snapshot  
lucaa - (15:37): caused by the fact that, when it includes the jsx in a page with 2 jsx objects, it only includes the second one but not the first one too. So there is some js missing  
lucaa - (15:37): does anyone know anything about this?  
lucaa - (15:37): any changes lately that might affect this?  
jvdrean left at 16:00 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 16:06  
Enygma` left at 16:10 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa - (16:10): got it  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 16:10  
lucaa - (16:10): caused by the fact that first object is not parsed content and second is. If I put both on parsed, only the first will be rendered  
lucaa - (16:10): if I put both on not parsed, both will be rendered  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 16:22  
lucaa - (16:31): sdumitriu:  
lucaa - (16:32): can you check this issue? I would say it's caused by your changes in the skinx plugin from 8th july  
sdumitriu - (16:33): lucaa: Paste, I wasn't online  
sdumitriu - (16:33): Which issue?  
lucaa - (16:34): (04:36:25 PM) lucaa: guys, there seems to be an issue with annotations on the last 2.4 snapshot  
lucaa - (16:34): (04:37:03 PM) lucaa: caused by the fact that, when it includes the jsx in a page with 2 jsx objects, it only includes the second one but not the first one too. So there is some js missing  
lucaa - (16:34): (04:37:09 PM) lucaa: does anyone know anything about this?  
lucaa - (16:34): (04:37:34 PM) lucaa: any changes lately that might affect this?  
lucaa - (16:34): (05:10:15 PM) lucaa: got it  
lucaa - (16:34): (05:10:44 PM) lucaa: caused by the fact that first object is not parsed content and second is. If I put both on parsed, only the first will be rendered  
lucaa - (16:34): (05:10:55 PM) lucaa: if I put both on not parsed, both will be rendered  
sdumitriu - (16:35): Aha  
sdumitriu - (16:35): K, I'll look  
lucaa - (16:35): thanks a lot  
lucaa - (16:35): as I wrote there, it's preventing annotations from working right  
sdumitriu - (16:35): Can you give me the URL of the SX holding the annotations code?  
lucaa - (16:36): http://localhost:8182/xwiki/bin/jsx/AnnotationCode/Script?language=en&minify=false  
sdumitriu - (16:36): K, thanks  
lucaa - (16:37): this was released, afaik, so I could report it, right?  
sdumitriu - (16:37): Yes  
sdumitriu - (16:39): lucaa: Are you trying on localhost?  
lucaa - (16:39): yes, why?  
sdumitriu - (16:39): Ah, nevermind  
sdumitriu - (16:39): return writer.toString();  
sdumitriu - (16:39): Copy/Paste  
lucaa - (16:40): (?)  
lucaa - (16:40): I tried with a different page as well, with simple jsx objects, and that's the behaviour that I noticed  
sdumitriu - (16:41): Should be sxContent = writer.toString();  
sdumitriu - (16:42): lucaa: My net is very bad, I can't access jira, I can't commit  
sdumitriu - (16:42): Can you do this?  
sdumitriu - (16:42): Make issue, commit, close?  
sdumitriu - (16:42): The change needed is in com.xpn.xwiki.web.sx.SxDocumentSource  
sdumitriu - (16:43): Line 139  
sdumitriu - (16:43): - return writer.toString();  
sdumitriu - (16:43): + sxContent = writer.toString();  
lucaa - (16:45): ok I will do it  
lucaa - (16:45): thanks for the help  
lucaa - (16:46): I would need to create 2 issues... for annotations as well, because annos won't work on the 2 versions released with this issue  
lucaa - (16:49): actually, i need a bit of jira help here:  
lucaa - (16:49): annotations won't work, we need to report this, but we can't report it in XAANNOTATIONS because there is no XAANNOTATIONS version it affects, it actually affects the things packed together in XE. Should I report that annotations don't work as a XE issue?  
sdumitriu - (16:51): No  
sdumitriu - (16:51): You can open an issue in XAANOTATIONS  
sdumitriu - (16:51): and close it as duplicate  
lucaa - (16:51): but it's not a duplicate, it's a depends.  
lucaa - (16:52): and I don't know which version to say it affects for XAANNOTATIONS, because if the same version is installed on a different platform version, it all works fine  
lucaa - (16:53): I don't remember if I changed XAANNOTATIONS version between M2 and RC1 but if I didn't, reporting this issue on that XAANNOTATIONS version is wrong: it would reproduce on the RC but not on the M2  
sdumitriu - (17:04): Since 2.3.2 wasn't announced yet, there's still time to redo it, if jvdrean wants to remake part of the release  
lucaa - (17:04): jvdrean: wanna redo it?  
lucaa - (17:06): wait I don't understand one thing  
lucaa - (17:06): for http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XSKINX-37 , the issue introducing the regression, it says fix for 1.13.1  
lucaa - (17:06): in the lib for 2.3.2 I see I have: xwiki-plugin-skinx-1.13.jar  
lucaa - (17:07): and the issue reproduces  
lucaa - (17:07): what's the plugin version for 2.3.2, still? 1.13 or 1.13.1?  
lpereira left at 17:08 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa - (17:09): 1.13 says here https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/tags/xwiki-enterprise-2.3.2/pom.xml  
jvdrean - (17:10): yes the release is wrong  
jvdrean - (17:10): I'll redo it  
jvdrean - (17:11): it's a perfect time to discuss who'd like to do releases  
jvdrean - (17:11): (not the current one but future ones)  
lucaa - (17:11): wait a second, jvdrean, I am trying to understand things  
jvdrean - (17:12): I released 2.3.2 with skinx 1.3 instead of 1.3.1  
jvdrean - (17:12): 1.13 / 1.13.1  
lucaa - (17:13): which is exactly why I don't understand the jsx objects issue reproduces on 2.3.2  
lucaa - (17:13): don't understand why  
jvdrean - (17:13): good question indeed  
lucaa - (17:13): can you try on your machine too, jvdrean?  
lucaa - (17:13): I took the zip from the maven  
lucaa - (17:13): so just start it, and go to http://localhost:8282/xwiki/bin/jsx/AnnotationCode/Script?language=en  
lucaa - (17:14): or whatever local you have, and tell me what the js starts with  
lucaa - (17:14): I am taking into account the possibility that I am running some wrong thing  
jvdrean - (17:15): I think I know what happened  
jvdrean - (17:16): can you try to overwrite the plugin from the distrib with http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/com/xpn/xwiki/platform/plugins/xwiki-plugin-skinx/1.13/xwiki-plugin-skinx-1.13.jar ?  
jvdrean - (17:16): and see if you can reproduce  
lucaa - (17:16): ok  
jvdrean - (17:17): the 1.13 branch pom was wrong at first since it had been copied from the tag (with version 1.13 in the pom)  
lucaa - (17:19): still can reproduce...  
jvdrean - (17:20): frack  
jvdrean - (17:22): it's worse than expected, give me a sec  
lucaa - (17:23): the sources of the 1.13 release on maven seem fine, I checked them out just now  
jvdrean - (17:24): yes but the artifacts was way too recent  
jvdrean - (17:24): could you try to download it again ?  
jvdrean - (17:24): http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/com/xpn/xwiki/platform/plugins/xwiki-plugin-skinx/1.13/xwiki-plugin-skinx-1.13.jar  
jvdrean - (17:24): I've redeployed from the 1.13 tag  
lucaa - (17:25): yes, trying  
lucaa - (17:26): yep working now  
lucaa - (17:27): so, what can I do to help? besides committing the fix from sergiu on the 1.13 branch?  
jvdrean - (17:29): yes please commit the fix on both trunk and 1.13 branch  
lucaa - (17:30): yes, for trunk I would create an issue  
lucaa - (17:30): or something  
lucaa - (17:30): since it affects the 1.16 released version  
florinciu left at 17:30 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa - (17:31): you'd replace the released 1.13.1, right? so the issue I would create doesn't have to affect 1.13.1 as well, right?  
jvdrean - (17:31): right  
lucaa - (17:37): i would need to commit on the 1.13 branch under XSKINX-37 , should i reoped?  
lucaa - (17:37): reopen  
jvdrean - (17:38): no need  
asdf\_ joined #xwiki at 17:38  
lucaa - (17:39): ok  
asdf\_ left at 17:39 (Client Quit  
lucaa - (17:44): jvdrean: committed on the branch  
lucaa - (17:44): creating the issue now to commit on the trunk as well  
sburjan left at 17:44 (Quit: Ex-Chat  
jvdrean - (17:47): I can't believe what I just did  
jvdrean - (17:47): I've deleted the 2.3.1 tags instead of 2.3.2  
jvdrean - (17:48): can someone pass me a rope and a stool please ?  
lucaa - (17:49): i don't know what to say jv, I would love to find something supportive..  
lucaa - (17:50): just that it happens, even to the best,  
jvdrean - (17:50): aha thx, I guess I still can co at the correct revision and do a copy  
lucaa - (17:51): yea, that should do the job  
tapaya joined #xwiki at 17:56  
tapaya left at 17:56 (Client Quit  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 18:01  
jvelo left at 18:03 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
lucaa - (18:12): I still have no idea how to report the annotations not working on the rc issue: if I report it on XAANNOTATIONS 1.5 and then close it as duplicate of the XSKINX-39 , it would be strange because the 2.3.2 would be released with XAANNOTATIONS 1.5 as well, but this issue will never reproduce there. Which is ok if you think that XSKINX-39 says affects 1.16 and 2.3.2 is released with something else... however 1.5 will be on RC2 as well (or final) and   
lucaa - (18:12): actually it makes some sense...  
lucaa - (18:12): users are gonna go mad trying to figure it out but it makes sense...  
lucaa - (18:12): anyone has any opinions?
